epd_metadata.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.epd_produced_by_address: Level 3, Greenhouse, 180 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia
epd_metadata.epd_process_certified_by_address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: Concrete for construction applications including residential, commercial foundations, driveways, footpaths, high-rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, public works infrastructure
product_description.hazardous_substances: None listed in Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern (SVHC) exceeding 0.1%
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
product_description.classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified (scope from cradle to delivery)
lca_information.time_representativeness: Plant data from 2022, mix data from 2023
databases_and_software: Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m3 of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered without packaging except packaging of materials

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: Data updated within 10 years as required

installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool
installation.activities: Pouring concrete from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation site work and forms

end_of_life.control: No control by Holcim over end-of-life fate

deconstruction.method: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

benefits_loads_beyond_system_boundary.recycled_aggregate_use: Replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete over its lifetime
carbonation.consideration: Not included in this EPD results; recommended to consider in whole-of-life studies per BS EN 16757:2017

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes

additional_info.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

resource_use: Use of renewable primary energy excluding raw materials
Total use of renewable primary energy

disclaimers: Results are relative statements and do not indicate endpoints, thresholds, safety margins or risks
Some impact categories have high uncertainty or limited experience
Ionising radiation indicator excludes nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal effects
references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative (2023)
British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR2019:14 V1.3.4 (2024)
Scientific articles on carbon footprint of Australia's construction sector
